results.title: Rolling Stones: time is on our side
results.brief_description: Video recording of the Rolling Stones performing at the Sun Devil Stadium, Arizona State University, Arizona, as part of their American Tour 81. Includes some of their most popular songs but the performance is probably not one of their best and the recording is of inconsistent quality.

results.title: Rolling Stone: 20 Years of Rock N' Roll
results.brief_description: This video includes interviews with: Mick Jagger, George Harrison, Jerry Garcia, Sting, David Bowie, Tina Turner, Joni Mitchell, Lou Reed, George Clinton, Robbie Robertson, Aretha Franklin, David Byrne, Smokey Robinson, and Dennis Hopper. It also features performances by: The Beatles, Jefferson Airplane, Otis Redding, The Police, Aretha Franklin, The Who, Bob Dylan, The Band, The Rolling Stones, The Doors, Led Zeppelin, T Rex, David Bowie, Bruce Springsteen, Jackson Browne, and The Eagles.

results.title: Rollerball
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: The next war not will be fought - it will be played. The year is 2018. There are no wars. There is no crime. There is only “The Game”. In a world ruled by Corporations, where no-one asks questions, the vicious barbaric “sport” of Rollerball distracts the masses and satisfies their violent and potentially rebellious impulses. Jonathon E., (James Caan), is the champion Rollerball player, but in a world governed by an elite, there is no place for an individual, let alone an icon of heroic achievement. Threatened by the head of the Corporation, (John Houseman), deprived of the woman he loves, (Maud Adams), Jonathan E. must make the choice to “quit while he’s ahead” or suffer the consequences. In an arena, where there are no rules, there can only be one winner. A sci-fi thriller with a chilling climax.

results.title: Roller skating safety
results.brief_description: Gives step-by-step lessons in roller skating through the story of a roller-rink skater who teaches her younger brother how to move on skates. In turn, the brother teaches his sister how to move safely on skates outside the rink. Emphasises that safety and etiquette are more important than the mechanics of the sport. Outlines the selection and adjustment of equipment, use of protective pads, how to fall, stop and turn. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Roller skate safely
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of protective wear in roller skating and also stresses the importance of routine safety and maintenance checks to skates. A variety of skates are shown, with suggestions for purchase or rental. Shows the important basic techniques of how to stop and how to fall.

results.title: Rolf Harris: How to Draw Fun Cartoons
results.brief_description: Yes, it’s the distinctive cartoons, drawings and humour of the unstoppable Rolf Harris and it’s Rolf Harris in person taking you through your very own “learn to draw” lesson. “You can draw”, says Rolf Harris. “We all can. It’s just a matter of knowing that you can draw your way”. How to draw fun cartoons, will give you as much pleasure watching as it will when you try out Rolf’s methods for yourself. Don’t say “I can’t draw” anymore, let Rolf Harris show you how.

results.title: Rolf Harris in Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: International TV artist, musician and comedian Rolf Harris visits the major tourist attractions of Tasmania. The film highlights national parks, islands, buildings, cities and towns, as well as industrial undertakings such as mining, paper mills, forestry and hydro-electric works. The leisurely pace of life and the recreational facilities of Tasmania are emphasised through the eyes of this famous Australian.
